translated: The Elder Upasena Vaṅgantaputta’s Birth Story
“The Lord Buddha Padumuttara,
the world’s chief, the bull of a man,🔽while sitting on a mountain ridge,
I approached the best of men.
Seeing a kaṇikāra flower,
I cut it from its stalk then and there,
decorated it with a parasol,
and offered it to the Buddha.
And I gave him almsfood,
the best food, a fine meal;
The Buddha, in his ninth year,
I fed eight monks there.
The great hero,🔽the self-made, the foremost person,
approved of this gift of a parasol,
and of the offering of the best food.
Through that faith in my mind,
you will experience good fortune;
for thirty-six times you will be the lord of gods,
and you will rule as king of the gods.
For twenty-one times🔽you will be a Wheel-turning Monarch;
you will have a vast kingdom,
incalculable in number.
After a hundred thousand eons,
you will be born in the Okkāka family,
and with the name Gotama,
you will be a teacher in the world.”
In the Dispensation that is like the gods’,
he will go to the human state;
He will be an heir to the Dhamma,
a Dhamma-image from the heart.
He will be called Upasena,
a disciple of the Teacher;
Because of his all-round pleasingness,
he will be placed in the foremost position.
This is my last (existence),
all (my) existences are destroyed;
I bear this last body,
having defeated Māra and his army.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations as well,
the six super-knowledges have been experienced,
the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Upasena Vaṅgantaputta recited these verses.
